newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sakata Seed shares fall on lower profits.
newsitem.headline: Sakata Seed shares fall on lower profits.

text.p: Shares in Sakata Seed Corp dropped on Tuesday, undermined by a fall in the firm's half-year profits announced on Monday.

The share price of Sakata Seed, a seller of seeds and seedlings, had lost 200 yen to trade at 2,400 yen as of 0504 GMT, making it the fourth largest percentage loser on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
The company said on Monday that its parent current profits for the six months to November 30, 1996, were 2.88 billion yen, down from 3.56 billion yen posted in the same period a year earlier.
